title: ‘Landslide’: Santana beats out Baker, Wu says, while Culpepper wins D7
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Rev. Miniard Culpepper won Boston's District 7 City Council seat, succeeding Tania Fernandes Anderson, who stepped down earlier this year.
At-Large City Councilor Henry Santana secured reelection, defeating former Councilor Frank Baker, according to Mayor Michelle Wu and unofficial results.
All incumbent Boston City Council district councilors retained their seats, ensuring continuity in the council for the coming year.

title: Jake Wilson to be Somerville’s next mayor, unofficial results show
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Jake Wilson won Somerville's mayoral race with 11,185 votes, defeating Willie Burnley Jr. who received 9,054 votes.
Wilson's campaign focused on improving city services and addressing issues like housing, street safety, and rodent problems.
Wilson previously served as a city councilor, chaired the Finance and Rodent Issues Committees, and led Somerville Youth Soccer.

title: Lowell police seeking public’s help with details about fatal hit-and-run
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Lowell police request public help regarding a fatal hit-and-run on Chelmsford Street from October 30.
Police have identified the vehicle involved but seek further information about the incident and its driver.
The victim was a woman who died shortly after being struck; authorities continue investigating with Middlesex DA.

title: ‘This is just the beginning’: Nonbinding Israel divestment ballot question passes in Somerville
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Somerville voters passed a nonbinding ballot to divest from companies involved with Israel's actions in Palestine.
The ballot measure received 11,489 votes in favor and 7,920 votes against, with 1,203 abstentions.
Anti-Defamation League-backed group opposed Question 3, claiming it divides the community and distracts from local issues.

title: Tom Brady just revealed that his dog Junie is a clone of Lua, his deceased furry friend
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Tom Brady's new dog, Junie, is a clone of his deceased dog Lua, created by biotech firm Colossal Biosciences.
Brady collaborated with Colossal Biosciences to collect a blood sample and clone Lua before her death in December 2023.
Colossal Biosciences, launched in 2021, recently acquired Viagen, a leading company in animal cloning since 2002.

title: Running unopposed, Michelle Wu secures second term as her national profile grows
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Michelle Wu secured her second term as Boston mayor unopposed, winning 91.10% of the vote as of 11 p.m.
Wu previously defeated Josh Kraft by nearly 50 points in September, and he withdrew from the race soon after.
Wu emerged as a national Democratic voice, notable for her testimony to Congress on Boston's sanctuary city policies.

title: Tell us: What should Mayor Wu focus on in her second term?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Mayor Michelle Wu is set for a second term after running unopposed in Boston's general election.
Wu's administration has focused on housing affordability, climate goals, and sanctuary city policies amid federal tensions.
Residents are invited to voice what priorities Wu should focus on, including housing, climate resiliency, and public safety.

title: ‘This is kidnapping — plain and simple’: ICE arrests 9 employees at Allston car wash
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nine employees at an Allston car wash with work permits were detained by ICE agents in a Tuesday morning raid.
Around 22 federal agents conducted the raid at Allston Car Wash, reportedly detaining employees before they could show documents.
Boston City Councilor Liz Breadon condemned the ICE action, calling it 'kidnapping' and criticized the agency's tactics.

title: Patriots opt to stand pat at trade deadline
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots chose not to make any trades at the NFL deadline, sticking with their 7-2 roster.
New England traded away Keion White and Kyle Dugger before the deadline to manage roster depth.
Injuries in running back and pass-rushing areas may challenge the Patriots later this season.

title: Amid SNAP benefit cuts, these Greater Boston food businesses are here to help
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Greater Boston restaurants and food businesses are providing meals and assistance to residents affected by SNAP benefit cuts.
Local establishments like Allandale Farm and American Flatbread offer free or discounted food to SNAP recipients.
Community initiatives include free farmers markets, community fridges, and donation drives to support those in need.
